clinical_study.brief_title: Nephrogenic Diabetes Insipidus During Prolonged Sevoflurane Sedation in the ICU: a Retrospective Analysis
clinical_study.official_title: Incidence of Nephrogenic Diabetes Insipidus During Prolonged Sevoflurane Sedation in the Intensive Care Unit: a Retrospective Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aim to retrospectively explore the electronic medical records of all patients who were admitted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the UZ Brussels in the last 10 years (March 1st 2011- March 1st 2021) and who received prolonged sedation (>24h) with sevoflurane.

primary_outcome.description: How many patients under sevoflurane sedation ultimately develop NDI? NDI confirmed by demonstrating the absence of a urine concentrating response to exogenous Arginine Vasopressine.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients that develop risk factors of NDI
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients that develop risk factors (electrolyte disorder, urinary obstruction) for NDI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of time patient was placed under sevoflurane sedation.
secondary_outcome.description: How long are they under sevoflurane sedation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with electrolyte abnormalities as assessed by lab results.
secondary_outcome.description: Lab results of hematology and chemistry labs show an electrolyte imbalance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with excessive urine output
Number of patients with an abnormal physical examination.
secondary_outcome.description: Typical physical symptoms of (N)DI: tired, lethargic, tachycardia, tachypnea, hypotension and dry mucous membranes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with urine with an abnormal osmolality
secondary_outcome.description: Lab testing of urine: osmolality < 300 mosm/kg

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients that show an abnormal amount of fluid intake
Number of patients that have an abnormal abdominal echo of the bladder.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of symptoms of NDI do these patients show?
After how much time do these patients show symptoms of NDI?

arm_group.description: Patients that received sevoflurane while in ICU care.

intervention.description: Sevoflurane administration to sedate the patient

study_pop.textblock: all patients who were admitted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the UZ Brussels in the last 10 years (March 1st 2011- March 1st 2021) and who received prolonged sedation (>24h) with sevoflurane.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sevoflurane administration >24h
- 18 years and older
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 18 years old
- Pre-existing diabetes insipidus
- Use of drugs at risk for diabetes insipidus (including lithium, cisplatin)
- Hypercalcemia (persistently >2.75 mmol/L)
- Pituitary or acute brain surgery
- Patients requiring continuous renal replacement therapy
- Pregnancy
